a.g: Certainly has Allah heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allah and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allah. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.

And Allah the Exalted has said: 'Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge by degrees' (Quran 58:11). And Allah the Exalted has said: 'Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest and fought' (Quran 57:10) the verse. And Allah the Exalted has said: 'They are degrees with Allah' (Quran 8:4). And the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Faith (Iman) is naked and its garment is God-consciousness (Taqwa)' (Hadith). And the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Faith (Iman) has seventy-odd branches, the lowest of them is removing harm from the road.' This is what indicates the connection of the perfection of faith (Iman) with deeds. As for its connection with being free from hypocrisy (Nifaq) and hidden polytheism (Shirk), his saying (peace be upon him): 'Four traits, whoever has them is a pure hypocrite (Munafiq), even if he fasts and prays and claims to be a believer (Mu'min): when he speaks he lies, when he promises he breaks it, when he is entrusted he betrays, and when he disputes he acts immorally' (Hadith). And in some narrations: 'and when he makes a covenant he betrays.' And in the Hadith of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri: 'Hearts (Qulub) are four: a heart that is bare and in it is a lamp shining, that is the heart of the believer (Mu'min); and a heart that is layered, in it is faith (Iman) and hypocrisy (Nifaq), so the likeness of faith (Iman) in it is like a plant watered by fresh water, and the likeness of hypocrisy (Nifaq) in it is like an ulcer fed by pus and blood, so whichever of the two substances overcomes it, judgment is given for it' (Hadith). And in another wording: 'it overcomes it and takes it away.' And he (peace be upon him) said: 'The hypocrites (Munafiqun) of this nation are mostly its reciters' (Hadith). And in a Hadith: 'Polytheism (Shirk) is more hidden in my nation than the crawling of an ant on a smooth rock' (Hadith). And Hudhayfah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: 'A man would speak a word during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and become a hypocrite (Munafiq) by it.'

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Book of Knowledge
Those who undertake the sciences are like those who undertake the frontiers and those who garrison them and the warriors who strive (Mujahidun) in the path of Allah. Among them is the fighter, among them is the supporter, among them is the one who gives them water to drink, and among them is the one who guards their mounts and tends to them. Not one of them is deprived of reward if his intention is to exalt the word of Allah the Exalted, without seizing spoils. Likewise are the scholars. Allah the Exalted said: 'Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees.' And He the Exalted said: 'They are degrees with Allah.' And virtue is relative. Our belittling of the money-changers when comparing them to kings does not indicate their lowliness when they are compared to the sweepers. So do not think that what falls below the highest rank is of fallen worth. Rather, the highest rank is for the prophets, then the friends (Awliya'), then the scholars firmly grounded in knowledge, then for the righteous according to the disparity of their degrees.
